image.altText: A gantry and a huge drill in a country area.

props.synopsis: The SA government hopes to exploit gas reserves but activists are disappointed and concerned about what that might mean for a regional fracking ban.

title.children: SA looks to regions for gas supply as market shortfall looms

image.altText: Dry, cracked ground on a farm.

props.synopsis: Crippling debt is growing by the day for drought-stricken South Australian farms with local councils pleading for state government intervention in the form of rate relief subsidies.

title.children: Councils plead for relief as drought-fuelled rural debt mountain grows

image.altText: South Australia's health minster talking to the mother of a child with ADHD

props.synopsis: Amid reports of patients waiting months and paying thousands of dollars for an ADHD diagnosis, the state government will allow GPs to diagnose the disorder in an effort to speed up the process.

title.children: South Australian GPs to diagnose ADHD in bid to cut patient wait times

image.altText: Man with bandaid covering black eye wears black hoodie and looks down at camera.

props.synopsis: Man who attacked a mother in the Adelaide CBD only a day after being released from hospital for drug-induced psychosis has been sentenced to eight months' jail.

title.children: Man sentenced over random violent attack on mother in Adelaide CBD

image.altText: Daryl Mundy

props.synopsis: A driver involved in a CBD car crash with a SA Police sergeant has called for greater oversight of cases where police are under investigation.

title.children: Crash involving SA Police sergeant prompts calls for more oversight

image.altText: A dead mahi-mahi fish with a blue dorsal fin.

props.synopsis: The deadly micro algal bloom that has killed millions of marine creatures along South Australia's coastline continues to wreak havoc and cause "complete ecosystem failure from the bottom up".

title.children: Wintery conditions fail to wash away SA's devastating algal bloom

image.altText: Police vehicles parked in the driveway of a property in Port Lincoln.

props.synopsis: A woman has been charged with murder in regional South Australia after a man's body was found inside a house on Thursday afternoon.

title.children: Woman charged with murder after man's body found at Flinders Highway property

image.altText: Drone shot of water and port surrounding a steelwork factory

props.synopsis: Following the first creditors' meeting, administrators of Whyalla Ports have revealed the company owes at least $194 million to various creditors.

title.children: Administrators reveal staggering debts of Whyalla Ports

image.altText: Man in a scubasuit stands in a metal cage in the ocean, two men in a small boat look over edge and chat to him

props.synopsis: In Port Lincoln, where some of the underwater shark scenes were filmed, it brought huge economic benefits, but also did untold damage to attitudes towards sharks that still linger today.

title.children: Australians behind Jaws reflect on the movie's legacy 50 years on

image.altText: Matthew Draganoff in front of a Union Jack flag

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court jury has found 48-year-old Matthew Draganoff guilty of the shooting murder of Simon Middleton at a property on the northern outskirts of Adelaide in 2021.

title.children: SA landlord found guilty of murdering tenant in 2021 shooting

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair wearing a black tshirt sits in a room at a desk. A green chair is behind her

props.synopsis: A woman who caused a multi-car crash, which claimed the life of a twin and seriously injured three others, has been found mentally incompetent to commit the crime.

title.children: Woman found mentally incompetent at the time of fatal crash north of Adelaide

image.altText: Jason De Ieso smiles as he wears a suit with wedding flowers

props.synopsis: Seven men who were sentenced to life for the 2012 murder of an Adelaide man have been granted a retrial after having their convictions overturned on appeal.

title.children: Seven found guilty of Jason De Ieso murder have convictions overturned

image.altText: Tomatoes on display at a store.

props.synopsis: A virus outbreak in southern states and wet weather in northern growing areas cause a tomato shortage and an increase in prices when they are available.

title.children: What's behind the tomato shortage?

image.altText: Smiling woman sitting in car holding rolled and wrapped newspaper in her hand out the window

props.synopsis: Wendy Russ has delivered newspapers seven days a week, "rain, hail or shine", and kept watch over her close-knit coastal community while perfecting her tossing technique.

title.children: Community hero to retire after 20 years of tossing newspapers

image.altText: A woman sleeps with a quilt on against a blue backdrop

props.synopsis: Felt like staying in bed longer this morning? It might be because the shorter days are affecting your circadian rhythm.

title.children: It's the shortest day of the year. Here's how that might be affecting your sleep

image.altText: A newborn baby is shown lying down, with one of its feet in the foreground of the image.

props.synopsis: Queensland police have finalised their investigation into a Brisbane couple's international surrogacy case with no charges laid. Surrogacy advocates say the case shows Australia's are outdated.

title.children: Couple who allegedly used overseas surrogate for baby won't be charged

image.altText: A heater on the floor with two feet warming up next to it. The feet have socks on

props.synopsis: Tourists are stunned to discover they were warmer back in a country that's blanketed by snow for months of the year.

title.children: Even visitors from snowy countries realise Australian winters feel too cold

image.altText: Jim Chalmers responds to ABC Leaders Debate, federal election 20

props.synopsis: There was no mistaking the impression that the treasurer is emboldened by the election result and wants to seize his moment.

title.children: Jim Chalmers wants to pick a fight on tax — and time is of the essence

image.altText: Image of UK military plane inside a base that has been damaged and spray painted with red paint by Pro-Palestinian activists

props.synopsis: British defence minister John Healey ordered an investigation and a review of wider security at the country's military bases.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian activists break into UK military base and damage planes

image.altText: Tech start-up founder Julian Fayed with new staff member Tien Hung Nguyen.

props.synopsis: While overall employment is holding up, there are increasing signs that artificial intelligence is eating away at opportunities in some parts of the job market, especially for entry-level white-collar work.

title.children: 'We don't want to outsource what makes us human' as AI starts replacing workers

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: In the triple-murder trial's eighth week, the prosecution and defence used an avalanche of puzzle pieces to present two contrasting pictures to the jury.

title.children: In the Erin Patterson puzzle, the pieces are coming together

image.altText: A man and woman slumping on their seats inside an airport

props.synopsis: Australians who were in Bali during a 2017 volcano eruption emphasise the importance of taking out travel insurance, following news of Mount Lewotobi Laki-Laki's eruption.

title.children: Australians stranded in Bali last time urge others not to repeat their mistake

props.synopsis: Over the AFLW off-season, Hawthorn's Tilly Lucas-Rodd underwent top surgery, a gender-affirming procedure that involves the removal of breast tissue in essentially a double mastectomy.

title.children: 'Huge dysphoria': First current AFLW player undergoes top surgery

image.altText: The front of the protest line with the National Guard shields on full display.

props.synopsis: A US appeals court lets Donald Trump retain control on Thursday of California's National Guard while the state's Democratic governor proceeds with a lawsuit challenging the Republican president's use of the troops to quell protests in Los Angeles.

title.children: Trump can keep control of National Guard in LA, appeals court rules

image.altText: A person stands on the deck of a ship holding a white balloon in the air there is a large ice block and water in the background.

props.synopsis: Scientists are venturing to the Southern Ocean to study clouds and the world's cleanest air to better understand climate change and the impact of human activity on the Earth's atmosphere.

title.children: Pristine Antarctic clouds hold clues to climate model blind spots

image.altText: West Coast Eagles player Jeremy McGovern walks off the field with a bandage on his head.

props.synopsis: West Coast Eagles great Jeremy McGovern has played his final game, with the defender urged to retire by the AFL's concussion panel.

title.children: 'This is the way the game goes': AFL star retires due to concussions

image.altText: Red wine being poured into several glasses, on top of a wine barrel

props.synopsis: Red wine varieties like shiraz decline in popularity while consumers opt for low-alcohol and sweeter wines like moscato.

title.children: Are Australians falling out of love with shiraz?

image.altText: A composite image of Joseph Dixon, a Black man wearing a suit and reading glasses, smiling, the 3 stars from Materialists

props.synopsis: ABC News gave the CEO and lead matchmaker at Bachelors Inc, Joseph Dixon an assignment — watch Materialists. Here's what he thinks of the movie, and he shares his advice for singles wanting to meet that perfect match.

title.children: A matchmaker's verdict on Materialists and his advice for singles

image.altText: A graphic showing a plane superimposed over the top of a blue background with germs on it

props.synopsis: As COVID-19 surges again in popular overseas holiday destinations in Asia, how can you stay healthy when travelling internationally?

title.children: With COVID cases surging in South-East Asia, here's how to stay safe

image.altText: Chris Brown in a suit walks in front of another man.

props.synopsis: Grammy-winning singer Chris Brown pleaded not guilty on Friday to a charge related to the serious beating of a music producer with a bottle in a London nightclub in 2023.

title.children: Chris Brown pleads not guilty to beating music producer in nightclub

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair wearing a baby pink scarf stands at the edge of an inland waterway smiling.

props.synopsis: When masters student Kinneret Pezarkar moved to Canberra from Mumbai, she found making friends a challenge despite being surrounded by other students who had left their support networks behind.

title.children: 'Persistent loneliness' in a city full of people looking for friends

image.altText: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto and Russian President Vladimir Putin during a meeting

props.synopsis: The decision comes after reports earlier this year that Moscow had lobbied Jakarta to house long-range bombers in the country's Papua province.

title.children: Why Indonesia's leader attended 'Russia's Davos' instead of the G7

image.altText: Brisbane AFL player Cam Rayner holds Dayne Zorko in the air as they celebrate a goal at Kardinia Park.

props.synopsis: The celebration for Patrick Dangerfield's 350th AFL game fall flat, as Brisbane downs Geelong at Kardinia Park to take back second spot on the ladder.

title.children: Lions spoil Danger's party at Kardinia Park, as Brisbane leapfrogs Geelong on ladder

image.altText: Shriya Lohia sits on a racing car and gives the thumbs up.

props.synopsis: They're young, fast and fearless. These are the teenage girls making waves in India's male-dominated motorsport circuits.

title.children: These young Indian women are shifting gears on what's expected of them
